name: tomato production, fresh grade, open field | tomato, fresh grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20311/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Tomato fresh grade during December, 2015- June, 2016 at a farm located in Village- Bhagatpur Ratan, District- Moradabad of UP. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 60,000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 10-Feburary, 2016 and harvesting date is 12-June, 2016. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 113.25-69 kg/ha. Herbicide used has active ingredient as Carbofuran 495g/ha, Cypermethrin 156.25g/ha Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 12.48 kg/ha using plough and rotary cultivator for soil tillage.   ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - tomato production, fresh grade, IN-UP, 2015 - 2018 (877f8df3-fbfc-408f-beee-46664f92cdbb)]

This activity starts about two weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in December and sowing of seeds started about six weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 4 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Tomato from the Tomato plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 30-December, 2015; Harvesting date main crop: 12-June, 2016
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Village- Bhagatpur Ratan, District- Moradabad of UP
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Tomato follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for the neighboring region (New Delhi) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Western Uttar Pradesh where the farm is located.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

flow.name: tomato, fresh grade
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of tomato, fresh grade is calculated to be circa 1.09E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.17E-05 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'tomato, fresh grade' is calculated to be circa 3.04E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.08E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
